children.subject: Is this an EE or CS class that you want to waitlist?
A language course
Please see my post below, unless you mean a CS 9 programming language course. We cannot approve time conflicts for courses outside our department.

If I want to waitlist in a course that has a conflict with a course I am already enrolled in, and I want to enroll in both eventually, what do I do? The course I want to waitlist is not full, but everyone is waitlisted until the instructor manually enrolls everyone after classes start.

I guess the catch for me is that, it looks like I can drop the EECS course, enroll in the NOTEECS course, and then use the form for the EECS course. However, that would put me in a giant waitlist... 

any advice would be amazing.

You're follow up post is correct. We can only approve your request to enroll in an EECS course. Therefore, you would need to enroll in the conflicting course first, then make the request. We simply can't touch other department's enrollments.

That being said, they may be willing to approve it or might have a similar process in place. I'd suggest reaching out to the NOTECCS department before dropping any courses.

Sorry :(
Thanks for the followup - I ended up clearing it with the other department :)

Sorry for the simple question, but does this apply to a conflict with an EECS class along with another department's class.

For example, I am currently enrolled in EECS 123 and want to add NOTEECS 100 at the same time? I've tried using the SIS form and it did not work after 36 hours, so should I use the form or not?

I'm not sure if I understand entirely-If the conflicting class that you cannot enroll in is EE/CS/EECS and you have seats reserved for you in our classes (e.g. L&S undeclared) or there are open seats, then you should fill out the form(s). If you're trying to enroll in classes outside of our department, you will need to speak with those departments as everyone is handling the class-conflict issue differently. Other departments cannot enroll you in our classes.
If we're not EECS/LSCS majors but want to enroll in conflicting classes, should we do it through our home department or through this form?
+1 - I just waitlisted CS 189, but I am enrolled in CS 162. I am unsure what will happen if/when I will be let into CS 189, since those two conflict.

I think I need a little more information to understand, but I'll try to answer based on responses from SIS. 

If you're enrolled in say Stat 133 and a part of the class (LEC, LAB, DIS) conflicts with a part of CS 186, but you meet the qualifications to enroll in CS 186 and CS 186 is open, SIS should be able to enroll you in CS 186 via the google form that will appear on your dashboard. If you're not enrolled after about 36 hours, you should fill out the CS google form above. If, however, you don't meet the qualifications to enroll in CS 186 (e.g. you're CS-intended and it's Phase I) or the class is full, we can't override the conflict for you while you're waitlisted. There has to be an open seat for us to override the conflict.

For the student's 2nd situation about being enrolled in 2 non-EECS classes and having a conflict with CS 170, this should not make a difference and my explanation in the previous paragraph should still apply.

Does this make sense?

I'm rereading this and confused. If there's a massive waitlist, 186 won't be open.
What happens when I'm #1 and then someone drops out of the class? Is 186 'open' for a bit? Am I enrolled or do I just stay on the waitlist and the first person without a conflict gets my spot?

I have this exact same question^ and wanted to follow up. If I finally get into the class but there is a conflict with a class that is already on my schedule, will the waitlist move on while the class conflict is being processed? I don't want to miss my chance of getting off the waitlist because of this.
^ +1, worried about "being stuck" despite a good position on the discussion section waitlist.

This has been answered several times (e.g. @2743, @2805, @2906).

The answer is: yes, your conflicting course will indefinitely block you from enrolling into the course you are waitlisted for.
What happens when you are waitlisted in two conflicting courses and you get into one of them? Does the system still block you?
Yes.

Sorry what I meant to ask is... Say I am waitlisted for two conflicted classes, and for one of the classes I qualify for enrollment. Does the system look at my schedule and see this conflicts with another waitlisted class of mine and prevent me from getting enrolled?
No. The system will not block you because you are waitlisted for a class that might conflict.  It will move you into whichever one it first can and strand you on the other waitlist.
Thank you!

How does this work with waitlisting (EE)CS classes?

Say I'm already enrolled in Stat 133, which has lecture 11-1230, and I want to waitlist onto CS 186, which also has lecture 11-1230. The system will allow me to wait list, but won't this cause a conflict? Will I be stuck on the 186 waitlist indefinitely?

Does the situation change when I have 2 classes I'm conflicting with? (Say, 2 NOT_EECS classes I'm already enrolled in that would be overlapping with a (webcasted) CS 170 lecture)
Please see my response above. A class conflict involving any part of the class will prevent you in enrolling directly.
thanks ~
Does class conflict count for discussions & labs or is it just lectures?
How did you enroll? When I try it says "There is no wait list available"

This is the problem. There's no way to override the conflict if you're waitlisted; there has to be room in the class. I'm not sure if CS 189 is currently capped at 70% enrollment until they know whether they can hire more TAs. For now, you will have to stay on the waitlist.

Once there's room, will a conflict form show up? I'm wondering if my waitlist position means anything in the case of a course conflict so that even if there's room, people behind me without conflicts can enroll first.

No, I don't think the system will recheck for a conflict and then send the form. You would have to drop and re-enroll in order for the google form notification to show up. Alternatively, you could fill out the CS/EE google form when there's space open and we could hopefully enroll you.

So in this case, would you say that the waiting list position is not important?

It seems like if I drop and enroll later, it would be the same as enrolling later. 

And when space opens up, the CS/EE form does not ask for anything about waitlist position either.
This is really frustrating to hear now...so my waitlist position is meaningless if I have a conflict?!?!

If you have a conflict while you're waitlisted, then no, I don't believe waitlist position matters because you would be stuck on the waitlist.

If you're waitlisted (or not enrolled) due to a conflict, these are the steps I believe you should follow:

  • Check to see if there are enrollment priorities on Schedule Planner.
  • If you meet an enrollment category and there is room in that category, plus room in your lab/discussion, fill out our EE/CS google forms.
  • If you meet the enrollment criteria and there's room, you should be enrolled by us.

I understand that this is frustrating, but we are finding out new information on how the system works almost daily and are trying to communicate this to you.

Not quite sure what to do even after reading everything. My situation is a bit complicated. 

- Am wait listed in cs161, which has a time conflict with another class that I am already in.
- Im not declared CS yet. Im declaring this semester. So i dont think i meet the enrollment priorities. 

Do I still fill out google forms?
You would not be enrolled into CS161 as a CS-intended student during Phase II. See enrollment policies here. If there's room in the class when Phase II ends, you could fill out the google form.

I'm enrolled in 162 and now on the waitlist for 189 which is at the same time. I don't see any conflict resolution forms or anything. 

How do I make sure I get enrolled in 189 when there's space?

I want to reiterate that campus has elected not to allow students to enroll in conflicting classes and that this has been messaged to students through the SIS emails. Any department attempts to help students enroll is because our department schedulers have graciously added this complicated process to their own responsibilities with very limited assistance.

"Swap" is to change classes, not sections.

The reason for the error: as the message says, are you already enrolled in the class you are swapping out of?

Why am I getting this error when I try to change discussion?

Error: Not enrolled in the 'From' Class, Swap not processed.
You don't get the form until you attempt to enroll in your Phase II.

I want to enroll in EE16B and CS61B in my phase 2 on December 2 -- currently all the labs for EE16B that fit in my schedule are waitlist only. Because of this, I want to enroll in a Friday EE16B lab that has open spots which will overlap with my CS61B lecture. I have all sections added to my cart, can I only submit the SIS form on December 2 when I try to enroll during my phase 2? I can't figure out how to do it ahead of time. And if so, will I be guaranteed that spot in the Friday lab, or do I need to wait those 36 hours for my form to be processed and risk the lab filling up? Thanks in advance.

If you're waitlisted for CS170 because there's no space in the class (as is currently the case for CS170 until TA hiring has finalized), then filing the form won't do anything, because the department staff can't add you to the class.

I am currently enrolled in Econ100B which is Tues/Thursday from 3:30-5PM.  I also want to enroll in CS170, which is at the same time. I'm a CS minor, so during my phase 2, I put myself on the waitlist for CS170 and enrolled in an open discussion section, was successfully put on the waitlist, but did not get any override form. Should I submit the CS Conflict form linked above and would I then be enrolled in the class?
I will only contact you if there's an issue with your EE class. I just went through the requests this morning.
I was not contacted, but I'm sure there is an issue between EE120 and 16B for lecture...
I'm not understanding-did I enroll you? If you filled out the form and there was no problem when I tried to enroll you, then you should now be enrolled.
I do not see the SIS form. Will I be contacted if my EE Conflict Override form gets processed?
It it up to the faculty teaching the class. You can contact them and ask if they plan on offering an alternate final.
Do CS classes (e.g. CS 10) generally offer alternate final exam times? When enrolling in courses with conflicting lecture times this way, how is this normally handled?

You could do the scenario you proposed, but you would still have a time conflict. If you would rather enroll in Stat W21 then you should do that. You could also stay where you are on the waitlist and then fill out the CS google form at the end of Phase II. Once the Adjustment Period begins, it won't matter that you are declared as the waitlist will be processed in order (see policy). If you do the latter, you should contact cs-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu as I'm not sure how often the google form will be checked once the Adjustment Period begins.

You could also stay where you are on the waitlist and then fill out the CS google form at the end of Phase II.

I thought earlier posts in this thread indicated that filling out the google form while on the waitlist doesn't help because the EECS department cannot manually enroll me unless there's open space in the class, in which case there won't be because there's still a waitlist behind me. 

e.g. the discussion section has 15 more seats, I'm waitlist #13 but there are another 10 people behind me, for a total of 23. From what I understand I won't be manually enrolled in this situation.

The SIS google form will not help and the department google form will not help if you were to fill it out now, but if space opens once the Adjustment Period begins it could help. You would need to talk with cs-scheduling though.

So if I'm currently #29 on the waitlist for CS170, the chances of me getting in the class are quite high. However, I have a conflict with that class and Econ100B, which I am already enrolled in. Would it be a good time for me to submit the google override form now, since it's likely that I'll get into CS170 during Adjustment period?

You can only have a conflict overridden for you if there is space in the class; overriding conflicts for waitlisted students does not work.

This class might be closed due to not having enough GSIs and will not enroll to 100%.
So should we wait till we're in the class to submit the form? What if the form and override aren't processed fast enough and the system kicks us out of the class despite us getting in the class?

The system won't kick you out, because the system won't let you in. The purpose of this form is to overwrite the system so you can get into the class.

If you somehow got into the class despite the conflict, you wouldn't have to fill out this form.

Scenario: I'm enrolled in the NutriSci10 class. I'm waitlisted for CS170 and the discussion I have picked conflicts with NutriSci10 lecture. 

I'm declaring this semester, which means I can waitlist CS170 in phase II (which I did), but won't be enrolled until Adjustment Period. 

However, from what I understand, staying on the waitlist is pointless unless I drop NutriSci10 because even if there ends up being space in 170 off the waitlist, Calcentral will neither enroll me (obvious schedule conflict) nor send me the SIS form (it doesn't send unless there's space right when you enroll). 

Does this mean that I might as well drop CS170 right now, try and sign up for another class I would otherwise sign up for (say, Stat W21), and then try to get 170 during adjustment period when I can actually enroll as I will be declared by then?

Since you are enrolled, you can switch to other sections without dropping the class. How are you verifying that the secondary sections in 186 are open? Going by the "green dot" can be misleading; instead you should click on the actual section to see more information. If 186 is cross-listed with another class, it's possible the other class filled the secondary section, but 186 would still appear as open.
186 is not cross listed I believe. What should I go by of not the green dot? Open should mean that there are open seats in the section correct? Regardless of the waitlist for that section?
After trying several "open" discussion sections, I finally found one that worked. Weird, but thanks!

I am waitlisted for a discussion section in 161 (in which I should I technically get in once waitlist is processed). However, I just realized I am already enrolled in a discussion section for 186 that conflicts with the discussion section for 161.

I presume from reading previous posts that I will be stuck on the 161 waitlist because of this conflict (can someone confirm?) I am now trying to switch out my 186 section for another section, and there are several that are "open", but when I use the "Options" function to do this, it tells me that the combined section is full.

What is going on and what can I do? Can I not switch to other 186 sections if I'm already enrolled?

Per the FAQs at the top, not entirely sure. I've been checking the EE form about every 2 days. I'm not sure how often the CS form is being checked. If it's been a while (more than a week) you could contact cs-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu.
Once we fill this form out, when can we expect to hear back?

You are welcome!

If you are enrolled in one of those classes and there is room to enroll in the other (depending on enrollment priorities), and SIS has not overridden the conflict for you despite having filled out their form (or if it didn't appear on your dashboard), then yes! If you had to waitlist the 2nd class and there isn't room for you to enroll, then unfortunately we cannot override conflicts for waitlisted students.

I was approved for the time conflict via the SIS form but it said the class was still unavailable so id be put on the waitlist. I chose a section that has no conflict with my schedule except for the lecture which was already approved but I still have not gotten off the waitlist after two days. I'm not sure if its because of the time conflict (even though approved does it not play well with waitlist?), enrollment cap (the class is 481/525?) or if it's something else. Is there any way to see why? Thanks!

Sorry for the delay. 

If at the time SIS tries to enroll you there is no open seat, you are then waitlisted (it seems from your example). Once you're waitlisted, the conflict override does not work. I assume this is for a CS class and that the class is capped due to not having enough GSIs to enroll more students.

I just want to say thank you for going the extra mile of setting this up!

I have a conflict for CS C8 with CS186 and I just submitted a form. Is this a valid request?

Thanks again!

Are you referring to the SIS form that appears on your dashboard notifications? If so, you should be enrolled 24 hours after filling out the form. If you are not enrolled, there is some issue but you will not be notified. At that time you can fill out our department override forms.
Once we have filled out the schoolwide conflict override form, what happens? Is there any special actions I need to take?
Not sure which of the three forms you're referring to, either way, it probably takes more than a few business hours for a staff person to process.
I filled out the form yesterday, but I can't add my conflict class today. What should I do?

The calcentral form seems of limited use. The cs conflict form is processed every 2-3 days. I will post a followup in a few minutes about what not hearing after a few days means. (I have just processed all conflict forms submitted by 11:15am this morning.)
Approximately when can we expect the changes from the processed conflict form to be propagated? Thanks!
I filled out the Calcentral form, waited for 36 hrs, no response, and fill out the CS form, wait for 24 hrs, still no response. Should I just wait? Is there anything I can do? Thanks.
I have processed all conflict forms for cs classes submitted by 1:20pm today (Jan 21).  See above for what that means/what to do.

Re: CS Conflict forms.

I have just processed all conflict forms submitted by 11:15am this morning.  If I was able to move you into the class, you are in. If not, you are not. I do not keep old conflict appeals "live" but delete if when I try to enroll you I am unable to do so.

Some reasons you may not have been moved into the class you had hoped to be:

1) There is no space in the lecture and/or secondary sections you have chosen

2) Similarly, the class you hope to be enrolled in has a long waitlist and all sections have waitlists. (e.g., 161 has 2 spaces in the class and a waitlist of 91 students and there is no discussion section that has more spots available than students on the waitlist).  We just cannot assume that you would have been at the front of the waitlist ahead of the 91 students who are currently waitlisted.

3) You hope to be enrolled in a graduate course but you provide no permission code. (Alternately, you supplied a permission code but the grad class is full or almost full with a waitlist larger than then the # of spaces still in the course).

4) Trying to enroll you into the course brings up an error message that it would put you over maximum units.

5) The only sections you have chosen that are not completely full (for a lower div cs class) are cs scholars sections and are not a member of the cs scholars program.

If conditions change for any of the classes you are attempting to enroll in (or for you), feel free to resubmit a conflict form. I am happy to check again when I next process conflict appeals.

The green dot that calcentral uses to identify "open" sections has some informational value but it doesn't actually mean the section is open. It shows green, for example, when there is one spot but an existing waitlist of 15 which will block a new student from enrolling directly through that section.

Yes, the form is for courses you are waitlisted for as well as for ones you are not enrolled in or waitlisted for.

Also, in the academics section on CalCentral, I see:

Does this mean I'm waitlisted for the lecture, but I'm enrolled in the discussion? Am I on the waitlist for discussion as well?

No. It means the user interface for calcentral could be improved.  

You cannot be enrolled in any part of a class without being enrolled in the full class.

You are waitlisted for the discussion as well but calcentral won't tell you what your position on the section waitlist is.
Thank you so much!

If I dropped and re-added the class to enroll in an open section, then lost my position in the waitlist, what should I do? I noticed that sometimes I'm waitlisted in sections listed as open. The class I'm waitlisted in also conflicts with another class I'm enrolled in, so the form would also apply to waitlisted classes, right?
The SIS form will be of no use for 186. That isn't the issue.
Thank you!

I filled out the CS conflict form but not the SIS form. This is because the SIS notification never showed up when I tried to enroll in CS186 (conflicting with my EE127 class that I'm currently enrolled in) and was waitlisted. Is there a way to fix this?
Faculty are not able to tell you your waitlist position for secondary sections either.
Thanks!
I understand students don't have access to waitlist position for discussions, but does faculty do?
Incorrect.  I cannot move any undergrad into a grad class unless I see that the faculty have given permission.
Where on the department form should we indicate the permission code?
Anywhere that's not your name or SID. Just add something like (Permission Code; xxxx) after either the class # or your choice of sections or whatever. I'll see it.
For grad classes, we only have to provide the permission code on the SIS form not on the department one right?
On the CS side at least, it is the latter which is why above it asks students to resubmit every three days if you are not enrolled and still wish to be.
Thanks

Is this conflict override form like the waitlist and swap function so if we fill it out and are waitlisted we have the possibility of moving off in the future as spots open up or is it a one time thing where we get put in the class if there's an open space and don't if there isn't?
Yes.
I am sorry that I am confused on the question that you are answering to. Just want to confirm that I should fill out the google form to resolve this, right?
Yes, fill out the google form.  See discussion on this post for clear direction on how and how often, etc.

I am enrolled in CS 160, and I tried to enroll in CS 170, but the class is now full, I had to put myself on the waitlist. But the discussion session of CS160 has time conflict with the lecture of CS170. I am now able to waitlist 170, but can I have chance to enroll in the course if the waitlist is processed? I tried to change the section of 160, but all other sections are full, I may need to put myself on the waitlist of other sections to avoid time conflict with CS170. If I do that, does it mean that I will be on the waitlist of CS160? I did not receive a SIS form, should I fill out the Google Form instead?

I was enrolled after overriding a conflict in CS 61A. However, I still cannot get access to any lecture videos in Cal Central. Does anyone know what might the problem be?

Thanks!
the form says it is for spring 2017, is it still the correct form to use for the fall?

history.content:
Dear Students,

As you are very well aware, the new enrollment system does not allow you to enroll directly in classes that have time conflicts. This must be processed by the SIS team (instructions). 
If you have filled out the SIS form, but your request has still not been processed after 36 hours, we will override class conflicts for you via a Google form (links below), space permitting. Please note that by filling out the form(s), you agree to have a class conflict overridden for you. It is your responsibility to check the attendance policies and make plans for conflicting exams. This is a pilot for Spring 2017 and we cannot guarantee we will continue to override conflicts in future semesters.
Please do not contact us after filling out the form to check on the status of your request. We will process the requests as soon as we are able.
CS Conflict Override Form
EE Conflict Override Form (use this form for EECS classes as well)
Note: If the class is full and/or you do not meet enrollment priorities, you will not be enrolled. If you do not provide 2nd and 3rd choices for secondary sections (if applicable) and your first choice fills, you will not be enrolled.
Sincerely,
EECS Student Affairs
FAQ:
Q: When should I use the form? 
A: After you have first filled out the SIS form and waited 36 hours. Instructions here. The notification takes about 1 hour to appear on your dashboard.
Q: Can conflicts for classes other than EE/CS/EECS be overridden?
A: Not by the EECS Department. See information on class conflicts here.
Q: How long will it take for a conflict to be overridden?
A: As this is a pilot, we're not entirely sure, but we will try to complete your request ASAP. Please do not contact us to check on the status.
history.subject: Overriding EE/CS Class Conflicts
